title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A fleshy fruity wine with tangy cranberry and red plum, and carrying a lush vein of pretty milk chocolate. The tasty barrel flavors are beautifully proportioned, with a finishing lick of cinnamon spice.

title: Savage 2015 Follow The Line Red (Western Cape)
description: This Cinsault-based blend, with 25% Grenache and 17% Syrah, opens with a beautiful bouquet of bright red cherry, raspberry and fig, all dusted by hints of sweet spice and fresh, minty fynbos. The medium-weight palate boasts fine tannins and a silky texture, with nuanced layers of earthy spice, tilled soil and tea that dance deftly on the finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Seacampo 2014 Cav #14 Reserva Especial White (Dão)
description: Produced from a field blend of 50-year-old vines, this wine is complex and densely textured. It comes from a vineyard near the mountains of the Serra da Estrela, giving a crisp character to this fruit- and spice-laden wine. Drink now.

title: Ty Caton 2015 Upper Bench Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From a section of the producer's vineyard, this wine is juicy and herbal, with a full-bodied robustness of ripe red currant and cherry. The fleshy fruity character is buoyed by a richness of blueberry and vanilla biscuit, as the finish offers black pepper and clove.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Crisp and light aromas of squeezed lemon, Pink Lady apple and Rainier cherry prove soft and supple on the nose. The palate is almost effervescent in acidity and crispness, showing lime peel flavors and a chalky backbone.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Zephyr Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: Roasted blueberry, allspice, nutmeg, loam and oregano show on the nose of this blend of 55% Syrah, 40% Zinfandel and 5% Viognier. The palate is rich and ripe with roasted black plum and mace spice. Very drinkable yet complex.

title: Bonny Doon 2013 Le Posseur Syrah (Central Coast)
description: A blend of three vineyards from across the Central Coast, this bottling shows lively aromas of violet and lavender along with black-plum skins and lamb meat. The palate has rosewater, candied rose petals, red plum and a slight maraschino cherry quality.

title: Boscarelli 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Wild berry, dark culinary spice, purple flower and a whiff of aromatic herb are some of the aromas you'll find on this vibrant red. The elegant medium-bodied palate shows pomegranate, tart cherry, clove and star anise alongside bright acidity and polished tannins. Drink over the next several years.

title: Château de la Dauphine 2017 Barrel Sample  (Fronsac)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe wine, neatly balanced by intense tannins and spice flavors. Fine acidity adds a layer of crisp black currant to the dry core of tannins. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Taillefer 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Spice and ripe fruit flavors gives this wine an opulent, full character. It is generous, with layers of black fruits, rich tannins and an open, juicy finish. Drink from 2023.

title: Clos l'Eglise 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. From a small estate, this wine offers delicious layers of ripe black plum and smoky tannins. It is rich, full, generous and already opulent. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Bernadotte 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Named after one of Napoleon's generals, this estate has produced a ripe, gently structured wine with great fruit. The core of tannins gives the wine shape without dominating. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Charmant 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Firm with bold tannins, this is a structured wine that has aging potential. At the moment, the blackberry fruits are still coming through the concentrated structure. Acidity and wood spice will gradually add to the mix with time. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Finely perfumed, this wine is open and full of generous black fruits. The ripeness and rounded juicy character mean that this wine is going to develop well over the medium-term. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Hourtin-Ducasse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Finely perfumed, this wine is open and full of generous black fruits. The ripeness and rounded juicy character mean that this wine is going to develop well over the medium-term. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Tayac 2017 Or Norme Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. A special cuvée from Château Tayac, this is powerful, dense and certainly worth aging. With an unusually high percentage of Petit Verdot (30%), it is inevitably dark. Packed with black plums and massive tannins, it will take time. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Haut-Brion 2017 Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This boasts rich and ripe tropical-fruit tones that are partnered with great acidity and a zingy texture. Already a beautiful wine, it's packed with fruit, crisp and deliciously refreshing.
designation: Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample

title: Château le Pape 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe, generous and rich, this is a wine with great black fruits and already integrated tannins. Spice, dark chocolate and coffee flavors promise a wine that is well structured while dominated by great fruit. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Faugères 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe and juicy, this wine is going to develop quickly. It has plenty of attractive fruitiness and is lightly spiced, with a crisp, fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Haut-Marbuzet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Packed with tannins, this is a classic from Saint-Estèphe. With a firm structure and attractive black fruits, this shows the potential to be a fine balanced wine from 2023.

title: Château le Bon Pasteur 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Dry tannins give this wine a dark, firm character. It has a backdrop of juicy berry fruits that needs to develop. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Dutruch Grand Poujeaux 2017 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. With a higher than usual proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has bright acidity and an intense black currant flavor. Structured tannins form a backdrop to the bright fruitiness. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Lestage 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: One of the properties that forms the Chanfreau family's Listrac holdings, this 103-acre estate has produced a powerful, rich wine. With tannins still evident, it will obviously age. But ripe blackberry fruit gives the wine a juicy future. It will be ready to drink from 2025.

title: Château Tour Prignac 2015  Médoc
description: This vast, 360-acre estate has produced a rich, generous wine in 2015. Its berry fruits are bold, ripe, full bodied and lifted by acidity. The wood aging (12 months) is very present but not at all excessive. Since it needs some time, drink from 2023.

title: Château Trois Moulins 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Equally divided between Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with a seasoning of Cabernet Franc, this richly perfumed wine is juicy and full of blackberry flavors. From the same ownership as Cambon la Pelouse and in the southern Haut-Médoc, the wine will age well. Drink from 2021.

title: Christie's 2015 Quinta dona Mafalda Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: With its 60% Touriga Nacional, this wine has rich, wood-aged perfumed fruit. Black plums and berries come through the tannins and spice to give a ripe character to this big-hearted wine. It still has a dry core and needs to be aged. Drink from 2020.

title: Dei 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Enticing scents of fragrant blue flower, perfumed berry, baking spice and a whiff of tilled earth float to the forefront. Savory and medium-bodied, the smooth palate reveals juicy wild cherry, raspberry preserve, licorice and cinnamon alongside polished tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2023.

title: Delaire Graff 2015 Botmaskop Red (Stellenbosch)
description: Vanilla and toasted-coconut-laced black-fruit abound on the nose of this seductive Bordeaux-style blend, with a solid concentration of black cherry, boysenberry and blackberry flavors. Medium-plus in weight, the tannins are bold but integrated into the plush fruit profile, and become well-resolved on the char-spiced finish. Drink 2021–2025.

title: Descendant 2013 Belle G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 58% Grenache, 26% Syrah and 16% Mourvèdre. Aromas are a little funky out of the gate but open to reveal notes of savory herb, brown stem, smoked meat, black licorice, raspberry and blackberry. The cherry-gummy flavors are pure and fresh, with a lovely mouthfeel. Black-raspberry flavors linger on the finish. All about purity, it impresses.

title: Castel Faglia 2013 Dosage Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: Orchard fruit, bread crust and a whiff of wild herb lead the nose. On the racy linear palate, firm acidity and a lively perlage underscore yellow apple, Bartlett pear and lemon zest before the crisp dry finish.
